detailedRequirements:
Until now our challenge app (non-meanio framework) has been using static json files for challenges.    This is the moment you have been waiting for.   Wire it to the real api!    However we are going to start with only the challenge create and challenge edit and we will do the listing in a follow up challenge.  This means that you should try to only edit code in client/edit-challenge and avoid  touch anything in client/manage-challenge if possible.

First checkout out the app code from https://github.com/appirio-tech/lc1-challenge-app and run npm install.   In the server directory you will see challenge-consumer.js.   This is the swagger generated node client stub from our api service.   The api service is hosted here http://lc1-challenge-service.herokuapp.com/docs/.   (remove the docs path, to hit it directly)   If you would like to re-generate this client stub you can run grunt swagger-clients which will call the heroku service to generate this node file.   However it has been provided so you don’t need to do this.  But it is cool and you should try it.    It will also generate the discussion consumer too from a different endpoint but we won’t use that in this challenge.    

Requirements.
1.  Include the server/challenge-consumer.js file in the server/web.js and replace all the functionality from edit-challenge modules to write to the service instead of the console.  
2.  You will need to pass the domain to this consumer, http://lc1-challenge-service.herokuapp.com you should do this from a config file or env var but we will all you to hardcode it in one place since we do not have our node-config set up yet.
3.  You should start with creating a challenge from the ‘new challenge’ button and since we are not touching the manage challenge module you will need to hit the challenge-service endpoint (http://lc1-challenge-service.herokuapp.com/challenges) to see the challenge you have created.  Feel free to look at the repo for the challenge service api if you need reference (http://lc1-challenge-service.herokuapp.com/challenges)  there is a sample postman file in the docs dir that might be helpful (you will need the standalone postman app not the chrome extension to see the payload of the calls)
4.  Once you have successfully created a DRAFT challenge (confirm from the GET call in #3) you should now be able to edit that challenge (by id) in the app by using the following URL:  http://localhost:8000/edit/#/challenges/:challengeId/edit   It should show you the app you have just created.   (Be sure to put you handle in the title since we will all be using the same data).    All the functionality of the edit page should work in your final submission.  
5.  The app has been changing rapidly we still have a couple of issues on this page that may be related to the static json file or maybe related to the merge of the last challenge.   You should also address those and make note of what you did.
6.  We have added some of our OAuth code but it is not working yet, so you will need to set two env vars to any value.   export TC_AUTH0_CLIENT=foo and export TC_AUTH0_SECRET=bar in order for the app to start.

In theory this challenge should be pretty easy.   You are just rewiring POSTs and PUTs from displaying to the console to using a real endpoint and this controller is provided.   However I am sure there are complications that I have not thought about.   In additions we want good clean simple code, and we want it fast (5 days).   So I am putting a higher than normal purse on this challenge to compensate.  

Good luck,   

I will be watching this challenge all weekend for posts  but don’t let an unanswered post slow you down.   Take your best guess at what you think is the right way and note it in your submission doc.

 

kbowerma
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
1.  Please submit a single zip file which contains the entire repo as your submission.
2.  If you are chosen as the winner I will contact you and ask you to update your solution with the most recent master branch and submit a pull request.  There is a $100 built into the first place prize to cover this update.   However if you do not get first place and we still choose your code, you will receive $100 bonus.
3.  Please create a file docs/edit_api_usage_30046908.md file which describes your submission.    It should include a manifest of all changes as well as details of what you did.  It should also include a link to a quick video that showcases your solution in action.   You may choose to annotated this video with text if english is not your first language.   You are welcome to shift detail from the doc to the video or vice versa but as a minimum please add the manifest to the doc.  (a simple git status --name-status should be fine)
4.  We welcome any feed-back on the app organization or existing code patterns or additional modules we should consider.
